data.event: The town center village, where 1,221 people resided at the 2010 census, is defined as the Troy census-designated place (CDP), and is located along New Hampshire Route 12.
Settled in 1762, by 1815 the community had grown so much that it sought its own incorporation.
Settled in 1762, by 1815 the community had grown so much that it sought its own incorporation.

event.title: was set off from Marlborough that year

data.event: It was set off from Marlborough that year, and included parts of Fitzwilliam, Swanzey and Richmond.
